Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph_Tobing
Reviews.Content: I was very cautious about booking this hotel at the very beginning. Some review about stolen guests' properties had discouraged me to book this hotel as the first option for our family vacation. Eventually, we found out that our hotel was far too distant from the main attraction and it has forced us to make an impromptu booking with Eurostars St. John on the day. Our first impression of this hotel was it nice nicely located within walking distance from the colosseum, palatine hill and roman forum. Gary, the receptionist was very helpful from the moment we checked in and throughout our stay. Gary patiently answer our queries in relation to maps, tourist attraction, supermarket, restaurants, bus station or taxi booking. He even give us a complimentary bus tickets for three days - he said he has two tickets which are unused and have let us to use them. We booked two connecting rooms. The room was nice and furnished with modern furniture. Shower was good and very clean and beds were comfortable. We don't have a problem staying with 2 young kids (7 and 4 years old) We always have our luggage locked and store our valuables in the safety vault having read the security review of this hotel. However, we felt that the security of this hotel were well maintained. We notice that a security guard was always on duty during the night at the reception areas. We thought that there was nothing wrong with the security system in this hotel. Breakfasts were good. Good choices of breakfast from fruit to bread to a full continental breakfast. The quality of the food was fine - good enough to provide us with calories before we explore rome. Back to location. Having situated between Labicana and Manzoni Metro Station, this hotel will save you some transportation costs. As I said, colosseum, the palatines and roman forum are within 10-15 minutes easy walk, or, if you are lazy enough you may easily take the Bus number 3, 85 or 87 from the nearby bust stop (3 minutes walk). You may use Manzoni Metro Station (5 minutes walk) to reach Vatican City (25 minutes by Metro). But one thing that we love is the bus number 85 which would easily cover colosseum, the palatines, roman forum, piazza venezia, the central museum, fountain of trevi, spanish steps, pantheon, piazza novena, and piazza colonna. We felt like this bus was our hop on hop off bus. We love the strategic location of this hotel. One thing missing in the room was the kettle and tea/coffee making facilities. We understand that most of the hotel in Italy don't provide kettle anyway - not sure why. There are NO restaurant within the hotel, but restaurants and bars are within walking distance from the hotels. Chinese, Indian and Japanese restaurant for example are within 5 minutes walk from the hotel - we have no problem finding foods. Another plus point of this hotel is that there is a sport centre (with tennis, swimming pool and gym facilities) literally next door - I do mean it is the next building after the hotel. Looks good even tough we didn't have time to use it. One suggestion to the hotel: please could you provide another trash bin within the room. There is only a small bin in the bathroom which we found insufficient. Again, we are happy with this hotel. This is overall a GOOD hotel with a good service and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: NazA03
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I decided to head to Rome for 4 days. After looking at pictures, reviews, price, location, etc.. we chose to stay at the Eurostars St. John. Overall we were very pleased with this choice. The hotel staff was friendly, spoke English, and very helpful. The rooms were very clean, big on European standards, but the bathroom was the selling point. Full tub with jets, great shower, there was enough room for four people to be getting ready in the bathroom if need be. Breakfast was also very delicious. The hotel was within 10 minutes walking to the Colosseum which was perfect if you did one of those "hop-on, hop-off" bus tours to get around to the sites and the city (we used it kind of like a taxi). Great food aalso within walking distance. As two girls traveling alone, felt very safe in not only the hotel but the surrounding area. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Only downside was that they possibly need more than one person at the front desk and you can hear all street noise from the church/youth center next door in the room (but that you will have no matter where you stay in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorate and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: metonyc Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is modernly decorate. It looks like a 5 stars hotel walking in. It is 2.5 blocks from the metro station and a quick 10 min walk to the Colosseum. The staff is very helpful in directing us where to go and speaks very fluent English. Their breakfast was excellent with all sorts of eggs, meat, and pastries. We had problems logging on to their wifi and was only able to use the internet for one of the days. I also felt the bed was on the harder side, but not so hard that I would not go back. Overall it is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the great city of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: poppyD83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in June 2011. After reading the tripadvisor reviews regarding stolen properties, I was a bit scared but this was the only hotel I found that was modern looking close to the sights and affordable. I was sooooo glad I booked it. Only 10-15mins walk to Colosseum and Forum. 1 min away from the metro station. Clean modern rooms. I would like to mention the night shift guy(cant remember his name, I think he's oriental) was very helpful. Everyday night we had loads of question regarding about Rome and he was always happy to answer and did it with a big smile.

Reviews.Title: “romantic rome”
Reviews.Author: ronaldvictor
Reviews.Content: Saint John's in Rome is located in a very quiet street at night, but on daytime , it is also located next to a school and sportscenter. However it didn't give me a bad feeling. Breakfast was excellent and the jacuzzi in the bathroom very pleasant and relaxing. There is no restaurant in the hotel. Other services, cleaning, towels,etc; ok. Price/quality ok.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant birthday stay in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: redredpoppy
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased that we chose this hotel for a long birthday weekend. Firstly, it was really well located for getting to the central tourist spots, two Metro stops from Termini and the Colosseum was half a mile away. We walked regularly into the centre of town to get to the Pantheon and the ancient part of Rome. It's also five minutes walk from Manzoni metro on line A. For one Euro, you can get to the Vatican in less than half an hour and St John's Basilica was five minutes up the hill. The hotel itself was spotless, modern and the staff were friendly and very helpful. They gave complimentary Prosecco to us when they found out it was my birthday and were happy to give us directions and maps wherever we wanted to go. Our room was very clean and was cleaned every day with fresh towels. The only slight down side was that it was very small and the shower was tiny. It did however, have a mini bar and Wi Fi. The TV had a variety of channels. We paid extra for breakfast and it was great value, anything you could wish for was on the menu, fresh fruit, cereal, bacon and eggs, pastries, cake, cheese, ham, salad, toast, teas, coffee and juice. There was also a bar but we didn't use it at all. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for quality, value for money and a great central stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel in Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: CocoNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: friendly hotel in a great location for restaurants which cater for a budget, a short 10 min walk from some of Romes Beautiful Attractions, Great Breakfast Selection, Beautiful deco hotel, this is situated nicely to be a wee bit out of the hustle and bustle but close enough for site seeing, Loving the dark wood interior, against the cream paint and fab art. very comfortable. This hotel has perfect rooms for three people with a twin adjoining a double.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nazdem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last month, and had a very relaxing stay. we read the trip advisor reviews after we booked the hotel so like anyone else we were very worried about some of the robberies that had previosly happened. When we chcked in though we expressed our concerns, and the employees ensured us that there are now new owners of the hotel and that they have new procedures (cleaners must check in and sign out) and there was security in front of the door at all times. Our room was very comfortable, bed was very big, breakfasts were greAt with a big selection, cakes, yoghurt, cereal, pastries, cheeses even ricotta and bocconcini which was a treat! Usually hotels only have 1 type of cheese it was nice to see they had a selection. The location is also very convenient, very close to colosseum, ten mins walking distance, bus and train stations very close, and if you live walking like me you can get around whole of Rome city by foot.we walked from Vatican city back to the hotel which took us 1.5hrs. You won't regret your stay. It was very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy place to go back to”
Reviews.Author: osofo
Reviews.Content: Saint John is nice and clean with a beautiful decor. Its staff are not super friendly, but they are very helpful. About 10mins from the Colosseum and the Central Station (Termini) its location is just perfect for the the tourist. Close to the major attractions, but in a quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: holiday08_11
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, friendly staff, good location - all sites within walking distance. Staff very helpful, and gave advise on buses, trains and places to see. Like to have cofee making facility in the room as there is no resturant in the hotel. would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Walkable distance to the metro”
Reviews.Author: Selvakumar1971
Reviews.Content: Located on a deserted street, not advicable to pick conversations with strangers,have to be cautious of cheats, walking distance to the metro, rooms are ok, free internet, hotel staff are alright and helpful, select items on the breakfast menu,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: LCH21
Reviews.Content: My Fiancé and I stay here for 4 nights in May 2011 and found the bedrooms very clean, modern with plenty of room for two people and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was huge with a Jacuzzi bath which was wonderful after a long day of sightseeing and the shower was amazingly powerful. Breakfast was well worth the money with lots of different food and drink to choose from and you could eat as much as you wanted to. The hotel is within walking distance of all the attractions and has a tube stop very close by. The staff where amazing, on arrival we were provided with a map of the city and the receptionist highlighted all the popular attractions and advised of what transport was best to get to each one (although we preferred to walk). The bar staff where very friendly and attentive especially Rico, nothing was too much trouble. On our last evening we asked at the reception if they could recommend a restaurant for our evening meal which they were more than happy to do and reserved a table for us. The meal was beautiful, by far the nicest meal we’d eat in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...”
Reviews.Author: Beks6
Reviews.Content: I was actually there April 2010. It was quite far from the airport and there's not much around it to do in the evenings. The hotel is down a side street but it was very nice looking. the room wasn't huge but it was nice, clean & had a lovely big bathroom. It had a bar & restaurant. The staff weren't particularly helpful & we couldn't get an iron due to apparently "health and safety" reasons - they recommended a laundry service who ironed clothes which was down the road & you had to pay for. I didn't want to pay for someone to iron my clothes. The AC didn't work or they didn't have any but it was so hot at night it was really difficult to sleep so we had to keep the window open. The hotel was within walking distance to the colleseum, palatine hills, fountains etc & a metro ride to get to vatican city so that wasn't so bad but within the immediate vicinity there was nothing. we did find an indian restaurant which suprised us but it made me sick that night so not the best start.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel, good service, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AdvocatusDiaboliAU
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, but very clean and tidy. Service was great, staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English well. Very close to Manzoni metro station, but still a fair way from everything else. Breakfast was fantastic and my 3.5 year old daughter was allowed to eat at the table with us for free. Happy with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a short stay..”
Reviews.Author: Jules24London
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and accommodating. It is close to a metro station but not very close to main attractions. Breakfast was slightly disappointing as despite it cost us €12 each, it served cappuccino from a coffee machine - definitely not what one expects when traveling to Italy. The room was very narrow but the bed was very comfortable. In sum, great for a couple of days in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our colleague was robbed”
Reviews.Author: StarrOxford
Reviews.Content: Believe the reviews. Our colleague had a laptop and a camera stolen from his locked room when he went out for dinner. He was told to report it to the police in the morning. But he is Italian and insisted that the police were called to the hotel. Hopefully this sort of report might make the hotel sort out its dishonesty issues. I complained when I checked out because I hadn't told my colleagues what I had read on Tripadvisor - I hadn't booked the hotel and I didn't want to pour cold water on our conference tour. I felt really bad. I told the hotel I couldn't understand why they wouldn't want to sort the honesty issue out. Apart from this, the room was nothing special, the bar service was absolutely comically terrible (the barman couldn't find the glasses!!!) and the hotel is nothing to write home about in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tasadofi
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again! Perfect location. Amazing breakfast. very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeYang
Reviews.Content: please don't bother with this place! got robbed within 2 hours after check in. Our room door no longer lock but hotel staff refuse to change our room or re-location but find out the next day 5 other people also got robbed (that is how bad it is) was re-located to a different hotel . Was told hotel insurance will cover our losses but 1 year on still refuse to return my email and phone call re the matter. If you valule your safety and valuables please don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: CecilieSB
Reviews.Content: A hotel I can guarantee I will prefer when I travel back to rome! Nice staff, clean, VERY good aircondition and a good location for exploring rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Average, reception was always too busy”
Reviews.Author: tannythestar
Reviews.Content: We didn't have bad experience like some other in our Trafalgar tour group but didn't get any good service either. Staff at reception were always busy. Our bathroom was very small and we have a few mosquitoes in the room (I killed a few but still kept finding more).

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to change hotels within an hour of checking in”
Reviews.Author: wallamercedes
Reviews.Content: I would definitely not recommend this hotel to a friend. The hotel front desk staff were snobby, rude and unhelpful. The hotel itself is nice inside, very clean and while the rooms are small, they are clean and have been decorated very nicely. The bed and pillows were comfortable and the housekeeping service was excellent. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because of the free wi-fi and it was HORRIBLE! Very dodgy internet reception, the username and password was not presented to us upon arrival even though we specifically asked about the wi-fi right away. Do not expect to be able to do any sort of business or communication online from this hotel. We asked to be moved to another room that had internet reception and they told us the hotel was completely full, which I do not think is true as we checked in mid-week and hardly saw any other guests during our stay. Overall, I am leaving with a bad taste in my mouth and would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Booking messed up and so moved to a sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: ana_w1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the first night of our honeymoon before catching a cruise the following day. We arrived late after our flight and coach journey to find that the hotel was either overbooked or there was some problem with the rooms/lost bookings (All a bit vague). Anyhow, they had no room for us and so we were moved to a sister hotel. They called and paid a taxi for us and the sister hotel was expecting us. The sister hotel put us in a superior room on the top floor to make up for the problem (although this room was in need of a makeover). As for the orginal hotel, we only saw the lobby area, which looked very nice, large and modern. We booked the orginal hotel for a great price (only £60) and so our expectations weren't too high. Only take a chance on this hotel if you get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid: Terrible service, understaffed, complaints met with a shrug”
Reviews.Author: ucantcmeimsmilin
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is not a four star hotel as advertised. We arrived, there were problems with our room, and we were accomodated elsewhere in the city. This inconvience was presented as a "bonus" for us and all we were offered was a free breakfast. No attempt was made to contact us before arrival. We insisted that they provide a taxi to the new hotel which was not automatically offered. We were to return to this hotel the next day, but they told us they would bring our bags between the two locations. We left to go sightseeing the next day (Rome is lovely, definitely worth a few visits), arriving at this hotel in the early evening. Our bags had not arrived (we could not check in as our passports were in them). We insisted on getting a room, and our complaints were met with a shrug. We had to insist that they send for our bags immediately, and were treated as if we were asking for something abnormal. The next morning we decided to go down for breakfast before going to see the Vatican. The hotel is massively understaffed, and the breakfast room had run out of most food, and two poor people were working as hard as they could to get food out. The food was terrible (the coffee by far the worst I tasted in Italy). I had to ask for cutlery, and separately cups, and then plates. It was stressful, and exactly what you do not need on a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Reception looks 4-star but rooms are worthy of 3”
Reviews.Author: eli90
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to read reviews of things being stolen from rooms here, we did not experience any of this at all. The room itself was clean albeit slightly smaller than we thought it would be. The rooms vary in size depending on how big the bathrooms are (we had 3 rooms in our group, one room had a bath as well as a shower so their bathroom took up space from the rest of their room). Our shower fixture was broken so it slipped down meaning we had to constantly bend whilst having a shower - we did report this on the first night but after 3 more nights it had still not been fixed. Also our window was very difficult to shut as it looked a bit bent. The breakfast was good although we have had better choice/quality in a 3-star hotel in Spain so we were a bit disappointed. The staff on reception were very helpful and spoke very good English when discussing the broken shower. However when we ordered cocktails from the bar, the barman had to write down the ingredients from the menu as he wasn't sure how to make any of them - maybe they are not used to people ordering cocktails? On our first night the receptionist recommended a restaurant to us (tempio di minerva) which was the best we went to during our whole stay in Rome, we even got money off when we told the waiter we were from Saint John. Our friends in the other 2 rooms had no complaints, everything worked fine so maybe we were just unlucky with our room. On the whole, although there are a few negatives, the location was great and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: Davism001
Reviews.Content: 15 minutes from colosseum, 45 minutes to Vatican. Rooms were ok but service was not very good at all nor was the staff helpful when we asked for input or ideas for dinner/ day trips

Reviews.Title: “Serious, ongoing security problem and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: jemmab060
Reviews.Content: We had two items stolen from our hotel room on the first night (14 July) - a brand new camera (bought at the airport) and a mobile phone, which we had left charging while we went out for dinner, so they weren’t in the safe with our other valuables. On the same evening, another couple had a laptop taken from their room, which wouldn’t have fitted into the safe. Looking at Tripadvisor, it seems as if at least two other people have had things stolen from their rooms in July 2010 (one review in English, one in Spanish), that there were similar incidents back in May 2009 and that there have been thefts from bags stored in reception, which leads me to conclude that this hotel has a serious ongoing problem with security. The manager was fairly helpful when we reported the theft, though he didn’t accompany us to the police station, as he had the other couple, assuring us that they spoke English (they didn’t at all, resulting in a very stressful couple of hours at the police station – not an ideal way to spend our first morning on holiday). He said that if we could get him proof of purchase for the camera and the phone, we would get some money from the hotel’s insurance (I think they are legally obliged to provide this according to art.1783 of Italian Civil Code), but despite providing everything that he asked for promptly we have heard nothing from him since our return to the UK, and emails and many expensive phone calls have gone unanswered. It's very frustrating. The other reception staff were incredibly unsympathetic, rude and unhelpful. The two women who were often on duty claimed not to understand when we said that things had been taken from our room, even though their English seemed pretty good and we weren’t the first - the manager was actually standing in front of her talking to the other couple about their stolen laptop. Never at any point did they show any reaction to what had happened to us, just staring at us stony-faced every time we had to speak to them. The manager said we could use the phone in our room free of charge to make one short call to our insurance company and another to T mobile, and that we could use the internet to access a proof of purchase for my phone emailed to me by T mobile. However this was not communicated to the reception staff, and we had to have quite an argument with the two women about using the internet for two minutes. When you enter the hotel, you turn left for reception and right to get to the rooms, so a thief wouldn’t have to walk past reception, and there is no secure area for bags to be stored. There are safes in the room, but these are quite fiddly to use, and very small. Entry to the room was not forced – someone had managed to copy the electric key cards / had access to spares. If it hadn’t been for this experience, we would have been pleased with the hotel, as we got it at a good price through the Lastminute Secret Hotels deal. The rooms are fairly small, but comfortable enough, with fresh decoration. There’s some noise in the mornings from the playground that the hotel backs on to. The walls seemed to be quite thin, but our neighbours weren’t up late, so this wasn’t a problem for us. There aren’t many shops or restaurants in the area, but it’s a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and only a couple of minutes from Manzoni station, on the red line, so it’s fairly quick to get to the Trevi Fountain / Spanish Steps area. Getting to Trastevere, which I think is the best place for dinner, is a bit of a pain as you can’t do it by tube – it’s walkable, but takes about an hour. Given the repeated security problems that they seem to experience, and the attitude of the staff, I would never recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “After bad reviews we were pleasently suprised!!”
Reviews.Author: starsky357
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night it was a suprise 40th to go to Rome and see the Kings of Convenience at the Parco Della Musico!!, which was fantastic!! We booked via the Lastminutes 4 star secret hotel and after reading some pretty bad reviews went with little expectation but to be honest we had no problems. The staf were very helpful, the rooms were great, small and modern with good bathrooms, this isn't a romantic 200 year old hotel but for a good location and functional hotel it is fine! I've been to Rome before but this time I found it amazing!!, probably because we decided not to try and see everything we just strolled around had a couple of lazy luches and enjoyed the atmosphere, a truly great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “staff Robbed €150, Manager would not discuss”
Reviews.Author: petermadden
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in July for three nights, with my two teenage sons. My eldest son left his wallet on the dressing table with his holiday Money of €130. When we returned the wallet was in the same place and the money was gone. we contacted the manager who said he would get back to us. my wife stayed in reception for 3 hours, the manager never returned, and in fact passed her as he was going for lunch. I have since rang 3 times and the manager has not had the curtesy to reply, not withstanding the fact that the receptionist promised he would. he least you would expect is that the manager would be keen to get feedback, especially where money has been stolen Not good enough. As a hotel, this was an average three star, very small rooms, very average

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and an easy walk to the Coloseum”
Reviews.Author: BradnMarianne
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms if a little small. Clean and well situated for the Colosseum and access to the Metro station is about 250m walk. Location was quiet and if your in the least bit active then the 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum is very flat and easy. Good buffet breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ponora
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The location was excellent - only a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum. Other attractions such as the Vatican were easily accessible by bus and metro. The room we stayed in was exceptionally clean and tidy and was fully equipped with air conditioning, satellite TV, mini-bar and en-suite bathroom. The only downside was its small size, but this wasn't a problem since we spent most of the day siteseeing anyway. The breakfast buffet provided in the dining area was great, with a wide range of hot and cold options available. The staff at reception were always very friendly and welcoming, and the hotel generally looked very modern and stylish. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans on having a siteseeing trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Staff tried to rip us off”
Reviews.Author: Xlin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Rome many many times, and this is the one hotel I never would go back to. The prices indicate a nice and a bit luxurious hotel, but what you get is small rooms without any space to move around. I don't feel the need of saying much more about the hotel it self, since the biggest problem is the staff and the huge lack of service. For exempel the tried to rip us off by taking made up fees of 50 euros for things that normaly costs about 2,50 euros (I know, because I've lived in Rome for a couple of years. If that is not terrible service, I dont know what is...

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LaBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Prime St. John for 3 nights for the first leg of our honeymoon in Italy. We booked through Brendan Vacations who were awful, but I digress. When we first arrived the hotel appeared to be modern and clean but kind of off the beaten path. We went to check in with Pablo, probably mid-50’s, one of the concierges. He was unbelievably rude. When we walked up he was on a personal phone call, and stayed on that call for 10 minutes while we stood there waiting. He then checked us in, told us it was late (5:00pm) so he was tired which is why he was moving slowly. We go up to our room which was the size of a large walk in closet, however it was very clean. We had two twin beds pushed together, which is the norm for Europe. One window, a TV on the wall (which you could switch the language to English), and the closet and bathroom blended in to the other wall, so for a moment I didn’t think we had any! There were no drawers, so we basically lived out of our suitcases. Bathroom was very clean but extremely tiny, also the norm for Europe. The air conditioner ran well and wake up calls were always delivered on time. However we paid around $350 Euros per night, for a room we could barely walk in. We only ate breakfast once and it was sub-par. Runny eggs, undercooked bacon and over ripe fruit with really awful coffee. As for location, we were about 10-15 minutes away from the Coliseum. We didn’t even attempt to walk to the Vatican and took a cab or this hop on, hop off bus tour. There are numerous restaurants on Merulana Street, which is around the corner from the hotel. My main complaints would be the size of the rooms and the awful service of the concierges. It was as if we were burdening him by asking simple questions, as in recommendations for a restaurant and so forth. Also our travel agent gave him documents to give to us upon check in and he never did. In conclusion, there are tons of other hotels you can stay in while in Rome. Go someplace else, save your money and be treated nicely while you are on the vacation of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Close to Colliseum”
Reviews.Author: Longton1
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, excellent service and a very good value. Many sites nearby including Basilica and a few very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, could not find fault with it.”
Reviews.Author: HolidazeSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute via Expedia and the hotel name is only given once you have booked and paid. We read the good and bad reviews on trip advisor but had no problems with this hotel at all. Location - It is a 10 minute stroll to the colliseaum max. There are bars and restaurants nearby to the hotel, turn left out of the hotel and head up the street then turn either left or right, or turn right out of the hotel and head left towards colliseaum. Reception - Fantastic, no problems at all. Always helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Upon check in we were given a map and all the major sights and metro stations were highlighted and all queries answered. Upon leaving, we had queries regarding our flight, due to the ash, they checked with the airport for us and confirmed that our flight was departing as normal. The lobby area is modern and comfortable. Food - N/A as room only but no problems with drinks from mini bar or coffee in reception. Rooms - A decent size room with everything you need. Very modern, free safe and a large comfortable bed. Towels changed every day and the largest towels were bath sheet size. Had Sky TV and sufficient channels to catch up with the news etc. Shower was a good size and again bathroom was modern. We overlooked the street but absolutely no problems with noise. Air conditioning was working perfectly well. Overall I have stayed in many hotels, all over the world, and had no problems with this hotel at all. Would recommend to a friend. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning and rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: Gustradamus
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights without any air conditioning, in unbearable heat. Rome had had a stint of great weather before we arrived so the room was very warm. The hotel overlooks a busy street, so when we opened the window for air, we couldn't sleep due to the noise! When we arrived and realised this was the case we brought it to the attention of the Hotel staff. Our complaints fell on deaf ears for 4 days, but what was more irritating was the wide array of excused we received... At first we were told 'It is a law in Italy that air conditioning cannot be used until 1 April every year' which was clearly made up! This excuse was quashed when we arrived at our hotel in Florence on 30 March to find that air conditioning was working fine and had been all year round! They eventually told us it was broken. On the second day we requested a fan and were told they didn't have one. Not exactly what you would expect from a Four Star hotel. On day three three they eventually managed to find a fan after countless complaints. We consistently brought it to their attention that air conditioning was advertised but they didn't seem to care. Aside from the air conditioning, the WiFi didn't work, the staff were not knowledgeable about Rome and completely unhelpful to any requests. The rooms also didn't have an iron/ironing board. There are hundreds of hotels in Rome with nicer staff, better locations and with Air Conditioning. Rome is such a great city... but needs a good nights sleep to be enjoyed, get it somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location with nice contemporary rooms”
Reviews.Author: SAIFAY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 2 min walk away from a metro line station and took us into central rome in 10 mins. It was a 10 min walk to the Colloseum. The rooms were tidy and clean. Breakfast was included which was great as food prices in Rome were very high. The night concierge was very helpful and friendly. Would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star...? Really?”
Reviews.Author: SRRVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Prime Hotel Saint John early February, 2010 for four nights. I like to think that we're fairly low maintenance people -- we do a fair bit of traveling rarely have anything negative to say about where we stay, whether it's a five star of a one star accommodation. I can quite honestly say that the Prime Hotel Saint John was one of the worst hotel experiences we've ever had. Where to begin... I work on the road, therefore requiring internet access - so we choose hotels with internet. The hotel charges 10euro/day for internet... but it only worked two out of the four days we were there. When I called to inquire about the internet not working (as I was on deadline and starting to worry), I was told, "it must be the weather"... and was then hung up on. I had to go to an internet cafe with my computer to work. Four stars? There were a million other little things that added up... Incredibly rude & unhelpful staff (ok, that's a big one), our glassware was not once changed... even though it had been used, the room was incredibly loud... and HOT... we slept with the window wide open in February... If this was a two star hotel, a lot of this wouldn't have bugged me... but it's not a two star hotel. And I don't care what your star rating... rude staff is never acceptable. Bottom line... don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location just outside the centre on the Metro A, fantastic room. 10 min walk from Collisseum. A+”
Reviews.Author: kobrien52
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel due to it's location on the Metro A line and because of a special offer price I spotted. It's very easy to get to from Ciampino Airport, €1 bus to Anagnina Metro Station and €1 ticket to Manzoni stop. The reception area is beautiful and the very modern room (we stayed in a deluxe) was huge with the biggest bed I've seen in a hotel. Jacuzzi bath and comprehensive TV service was extremely relaxing after long days walking around Rome and it is just far enough outside the centre to enjoy local prices in the nearby restaurants and supermarkets. Room was cleaned everyday no matter what time we left it and the air-conditioning was a welcome extra.We didn't eat there so can't comment on the food in-house. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome. Other, more central, hotels I had looked at before picking this one seemed shabby in comparison when I saw them up close.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced !! Bad service ! Very Hot inside the room ! Good location”
Reviews.Author: spart74
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to the average price and Locatioin .The location was really very Good ! At a walking distance to many of the popular tourist sites in Rome (the hotel is within 10 minutes to the Colosseum). The hotel is also located close to a train line. The room was very small and really very HOT ! There must be something wrong with the heating and we had the window wide open during our stay ! ( and it was January !) The stuff at the front desk was really unick !! There was a lady that whenever you were reaching the front desk you felt like she would slap your face !. The internet access is very expensive ( 5 € for 2 hours ) and is given to you in a very stupid way !! You have to go down to the front desk and take an access code ! I'm be honest and say that I usually do not post reviews to Trip Advisor. However, I felt compelled to write a review specifically for this hotel because my experience was so bad

Reviews.Title: “Hit the jackpot - loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PopeWaver3
Reviews.Content: I put a lot of work into researching Roman hotels so I'm particularly pleased that I hit the jackpot with Prime St John. Modern hotel: this seemed to be the only modern hotel I could find in Rome within reasonable price bracket. Most hotels boast about "authentic 18th century building" which unfortunately usually means creaky stuff that doesnt work. While I appreciate old buildings from the outside, I dont like tolerating what "old" means to sleep in. We once stayed in a "Hotel Moderna" in Sienna which was a 200 year old dump. Here, the beds were super comfortable, though the rooms did overheat (in late November!) The lobby / bar area is super classy looking, though they could use the area more, there's a lot of expensive Italian sofas lying around in an empty room downstairs which they could be using as a more lively bar area. We'd like to bring our daughter next time, so I was glad to see a few children in the hotel, though most people seemed to be couples in their 30s/40s. Central: 5 minute walk to metro. Another scary term for Roman hotels is: "away from the hustle and bustle of Rome", which seems to translate as "in Milan". Reasonable: €200 for 2 nigths seemed to be a great deal for a 4 star. Only snag: I thought charging for WiFi in a 4 star hotel was a little stingy, you'd never expect to pay for it in most hotels in Dublin. staff were sound, though a little clueless about their city. When we ventured to ask the guy behind the counter if there was anything special on this weekend, he recommended a 20 mile day trip to some site outside of Rome. Knowing we were staying just 2 days in the greatest city in the world, suggesting we leave it to see some ruin seemed ridiculous, but they're very nice people nonetheless. Breakfast: Most reviews of Roman hotels seem to slate the breakfast. I can only conclude that Italians dont really value breakfast as a meal as much as perhaps people in Ireland, England or northern Europe do. To them, breakfast isnt a meal, its just an esspresso with a croissant. In this hotel, breakfast was good, you couldnt complain about it, but not spectacular, maybe at 3 star standard. The one shock for me as a coffee lover was the sight of a coffee machine !!!! from which we were supposed to get coffee, though it transpired that it was decent enough. Nice scrambled egg, average cooked ham, average juice (from concentrate which seems to be the norm - you wouldnt get away with that in a 3 star in Dublin) and then assorted cereals and yoghurt. Arrivederci, Fergus Keane, Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed and very happy”
Reviews.Author: mad_ed_k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a small and quiet side street which is 5 mins walk to a tube station. This is the cheapest way to travel in rome with an all day ticket costing 4 euros, it is quick - train every few minutes and safe. Also in the vacintiy of the hotel are some very nice restaurants that serve very nice and tasty dishes. They are all within walking distance and you may welcome this after day of sightseeing and walking around. The hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms are not massive but are more than big enough for what you will need. Our bathroom was quite big and not at all small as some reviews mention. The beds are comfy an each room has its own sky box! The breakfast os buffet style and very fresh getting replaced every few mins. There is something for everyone. Overall i loved Rome and will return and this hotel was great and would also stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: york28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Prime Hotel Saint John in Rome during my recent trip to Europe. We selected this hotel due to the average price and walking distance to many of the popular tourist sites in Rome (the hotel is within 10 minutes to the Colosseum). The hotel is also located close to a train line. The rooms are average size and for the most part were clean. The shower is so small you can barely turn around. We had an issue with our shower flooding the first day, but the hotel fixed it within a few hours. The hotel is incredibly noisy. There are two choices of rooms. One side overlooks a schoolyard. The other overlooks the street. Regardless of what the other reviews say, neither choice is good as far as noise is concerned. We had a room facing the street. Although there isn't much traffic, there is constant slamming of doors and talking into the late hours since the entrance is right below you. If you choose the school side, have fun with the screaming kids at 7 am. Don't plan on getting much sleep at this hotel if you choose it. The worst part about the hotel is the service and staff. I travel frequently and have never encountered such rude staff at a hotel. Not one, but all of them. Quick story....we ran out of toilet paper in our room one night. I called down to the front desk to ask them for me. Their response...."we don't have anyone to bring it up"? My response...."would you like me to use my hand?". After almost arguing with them, they finally "agreed" to bring it up. I have a dozen stories just like this from my stay at this hotel. Don't expect any service and if you ask for something, expect to feel like you are bothering them. Another thing.....we visited in late April. It was unusually hot during the week we visited (high 80s during the day). The hotel is located in a very old building. While I understand that Italy has some laws about turning on the A/C before summer (not sure if this is true, but this is what the hotel told us), it got incredibly hot inside the building. I am not joking when I say it must have been high 90s. Awful for spending any time in the hotel whatsoever. I'm be honest and say that I usually do not post reviews to Trip Advisor. However, I felt compelled to write a review specifically for this hotel because my experience was so bad. I am usually not one to complain about hotels, but our stay at this one was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “what a shame”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandDoug
Reviews.Content: It is a shame to have to write a poor review. From our 4 week trip in Italy we have just written some fantastic reviews of other hotels. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the part of our honeymoon at the Prime Hotel Saint John. Although the hotel is located in a good position (we walked all over Rome) we found the front desk staff particularly unfriendly and on entering our room were further disappointed to see that it was very small and overlooked a noisy school playground. Despite the fact that we had mentioned in advance that we were on our honeymoon, the hotel staff did not acknowledge this at all and had clearly not taken this into account when allocating our room. However, we tried to make the best of it (including the tiny bathroom). The internet connection (for which there was an additional fee) was very patchy and we wasted a lot of time on this. When we tried to phone reception we could not communicate over the static on the line and had to go to reception whenever we wanted anything - however, having no hotel information in the room (e.g. room service menu, directory), what we wanted was a bit of a guessing game! We certainly wouldn't stay here again. What a shame - this hotel feels like it is relying on coach-trip trade and not trying to please its individual customers.

Reviews.Title: “5mins from colosseum, walking distance from everything else, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: 2050worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel, i booked it on a short notice. Reception was a bit dull, but who cares? I didn't go to be spending time with them i went to experience ROME! Room was clean, there was a lovely comfy double bed, tube shower, flat screen TV, mini fridge, the view wasnt so great it was only facing another building. Breakfast was OK, for a 4* i was expecting more than just bread and ham. The scrambled eggs were lovely though. 5minute walk to the colosseum and a walking distance from everywhere, vittorio emanuel building, trevi fountain, spanish steps, shops, and shops, and restaurants. EVERYTHING was great! To visit the vatican city and museum you'd have to the the metro to Ottaviano which is only a few stops from Manzoni metro station (it's the one near the hotel) love the transport, the people, the scenery, everything! Make sure you check out the designer shops in Flaminio. GREAT TRIP!! message me if you need any top tips!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made a special trip perfect”
Reviews.Author: sam12Lanarkshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel in an excellent position, only 2 blocks, a 2 minute walk from Manzoni Metro station, which is on the line for most major attractions. We were in room 501 which has a terrace and a hot tub, perfect after a day of sightseeing. Room was air conditioned and bathroom had a large double shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful in giving us advice on sightseeing, restaurants etc. We stayed in Prime Hotel Saint John for 5 nights and the only slight comment was that tea and coffee facilities were not in the room, but this in now way would reduce my recommendation of 5 stars. I loved evey minute in the Rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic first hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travellerZoobrick
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with Metro only a couple blocks away. Good sized air conditioned bedroom which is modern and very clean. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Iines6
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Prime Hotel Saint John in the end of June. We had two connected double rooms (family room) an it was good solution. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good; it did included also fresh vegetables (not boiled) and fruits, which is not so obvious in all european countries. Location was also good. We did not use public transportation at all, we walked around the city to see all these famous sights. It took only ten minutes to walk to the colosseum. We have been visiting Rome few years ago, an then we stayed nearby Termini, and after that visit, we really prefer location of this Prime Hotel. Staff was OK, and we got that service we did ask. I could really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Phone Booth shower”
Reviews.Author: Mcdude82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Prime Hotel St. John for two nights. The hotel is well situated in a quiet neighborhood. It is close to the Metro and some sites. The hotel is fairly new and well maintained. Our room was very small, but clean. Our only dissapointment was the bathroom shower. It was very small and you almost had to be a contortionist to get in and out of it. The breakfast was good and the staff were very friendly. Overall we had a nice experience and would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: swolentoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one noght in May 2009. Booked it with last minute as a top secret hotel. The location was great. 10 minute walk from Termini or 2 stops on the underground. The underground station is only about a minutes walk away. We arrived before 2 so the room wasnt ready so the reception staff took our bags and directed us to a nearby cafe for 30 mins. The room was very small however the bathroom was huge and it was very modern and clean. We had alot of sky TV chgannels but not so many in English. Air con worked. It is only a 10 minute walk to the colleseum which we done at night. We passed by an area with alot of great cafes / bars and the walk back at night was fine. We felt totally safe walking this area at night. For the price i paid i would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Breakfast, Working AC”
Reviews.Author: a786374534
Reviews.Content: Now, upon reading some of the negative reviews we were a little afraid, but it turned out better than expected. We liked the location: about 10 minutes walk from subway station, about 15-20 min from Colliseum. Rooms were clean and modern - and they had working AC, which is not common at all in Rome. Breakfast was OK (not super). Overall, it was great value for the money (we paid about $140/night including taxes via Expedia) and great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: snoogle
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks to be very chique and modern on first glimpse but its problems soon become evident. Specifically, our bathroom smelled vaguely of sewage, the breakfast included in the room rate was terrible, the staff was surly and the hotel was robbed by gypsys (this is who the desk clerk blamed) while we were there....apparently they broke in somehow and stole laptops and other easily portable items from the rooms...seemed very shady to us, I would not be surprised if the staff were in on it. Also the hotel is on a dirty and slightly sketchy street and lcoated kind of on the periphery of all the main attractions, not at all worth it, very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and good location”
Reviews.Author: 2abc
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a very good value for your Rome-money. Early check-in possible if room is avbl. and storage for bags/suitcase after check-out!! Modern and clean rooms with a/c , satellite flatscreen tv, good windows and friendly service in a quiet sidestreet just about 3 minutes to Subway and many Buslines incl. Nightbus service. The rooms might be on the small side but nicely furnished, just the lack of a showercurtain at the bathtub was a bit disturbing and can lead to some flooding in the bathroom. Chambermaids where very quik and efficient. The Breakfast-crew usually had a hard time stocking up clean plates and bowls as well as keeping up to clean tables. Careful: If your Creditcard is from a non Euro currency Country, insist on being charged in Euros and let your Bank/Institute do the conversion.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: PeterDo
Reviews.Content: good location: walking distance to the metro and to the Colosseum. The only weakness of the hotel is the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle75
Reviews.Content: whilst the rooms were very small, the hotel was very clean and well run. The reception staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. It didn't matter that the hotel room was small because the purpose of our visit was to sightsee and explore the wonderful city of Rome. Walking distance to the Coliseum and easy access to the metro providing easy access to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gaviota2
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mom at this hotel for 3 nights on December 2008. The hotel is fairly new, with a contemporary style. The room was clean but really tiny. If the bathroom door was open, I couldn't pass by. The temperature was great for when we were coming back from the cold weather. The bathroom was big and clean. The tv wasn't working the first night and when I called the front desk, they told me they didn't have a maintance person in at that time. They never offered to change rooms or anything. The tv was fixed the next day. The hotel is walking distance to the colisseum but far from the rest of the attractions, even thou the subway is 1 block 1/2 from the hotel. We walked from the subway station to the hotel at night and it was dark and lonely, but we made it there safely. Breakfast was great and a great way to start the day. The front desk service was just not very friendly, but just ok. Something that surprised me was that they didn't have internet service. The closest one was around the corner from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: heeelllooo
Reviews.Content: We had never used the top secret hotel booking before and were quite reluctant to do so but we had no need to be as the hotel was better than expected. On arrival we found the street the hotel was on to be very quiet although it was only 2 minutes from the nearest metro station and 10 mins from the colesseum. The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful as soon as we arrived, they gave us maps to show the nearest station, restauraunts and tourist spots etc. They were able to answer every question with ease. The rooms were lovely, if a little hot at nights. (We constantly had the window open) Two tips for the room: 1) Take your own hair dryer 2) The temperature in the shower is very temperamental. Perfect hotel for a perfect city!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good location - reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Harmothoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights in early March. The hotel is very clean; the subway is two blocks away and the hotel itself is in a reasonably safe area of the city. Many atractions are walking distance, but at 1 euro a trip or 4 euros a day for unlimited use, you'll probably find the subway useful - there will be plenty of walking even if you do make use of it. There are a few decent restaurants nearby for evenings when you're too tired to be bothered to go far, but no restaurant in the hotel. There are local shops where you can find the odd things you need, and a nearby internet cafe if you don't want to bring your laptop (the lobby is a wireless hotspot apparently, but I didn't try it myself - my vacation included a break from email!) I have a few criticisms. First, the breakfast buffet is okay but not stellar. They do have the worst damn coffee I have ever had the misfortune of getting out of one of those automatic machines. It was netiher cappichino nor plain coffee, but some sort of weak, frothy inbetween thing whose sole virtue was caffeine content. Since the buffet doesn't start until 7am, if you're a morning person each day can be a bit of a coffee crisis. There are nearby coffee places which are quite good. Second, I found the desk staff to be amazingly helpful and friendly. They were endlessly willing to give directions and advice. However, they distribute some written directions on how to get to certain locations using public transportation, and some of their busstop information is not correct. However, all things considered, they do a fabulous job of helping their guests get around the city and with a bit of double-checking that sheet they'll be first-rate in this respect. The rooms are very comfortable, but the climate control can be a bit off. I believe they were running the heating during my visit - the lobby would be comfortable but my third floor room got quite hot at times and I was opening the window to get comfortable. With all the pretty incandescent lighting, it can get really warm - I had to turn off most of the lights as well to avoid a broil situation. It was manageable, but I can see problems in warmer months - request a lower-floor room away from the street is my advice. Some people seem to think this hotel is expensive, but it's really very affordable for Rome in general, especially considering the location. I would stay there again - if you want more creature comforts, expect to pay quite a bit more than their rates. I've stayed in quite a few European hotels and it's always a bit of a shock if most of your travel experience is in the US. This one is quite good value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect, decent price, local and great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dgbellagio
Reviews.Content: Yes, as others have stated, there is a school yard next to the hotel, but knowing this, simply request a room on the other side of the hotel, as I did, and everything was great! The rooms are modern, and best of all clean. It is about a block and a half from the metro which takes you to all of sites, and is also very close to the Colosseum. Also, if you have time the hotel is only minutes from a great (very little known) attractrion called Basillica St. Clement http://www.sacred-destinations.com/italy/rome-san-clemente.htm The hotel has a free breakfast as many of the hotels in Italy so, but in my experience they offered the most extensive and FRESH choices. This hotel was a great bargain because we are on a budget. If you stay (or eat) on a Piazza which us Americans think is so great, you will most likely be waaay overpaying, and typically getting something very sub-par simply for the location. Prime Hotel St. John is slightly off the beaten path, but extremely easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: honeyblackpool
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for our wedding anniversary and yes it was close to everywhere we wanted to visit. But as in previous reviews the beautiful courtyard picture is a school playground, so was quite noisy. I definately wouldnt rate this a 4* more like a bed and breakfast. Totally over priced and the rooms were ok but not spectacular. Some of the staff were lovely but others who spoke perfectly good english were very rude and arrogant. I will definately be visiting Rome again but i wouldnt choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel a short walk from the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: kaleidoscope_65
Reviews.Content: This hotel made a good base for a sightseeing trip to Rome - quite central, close to a Metro station and comfortable without being too expensive. Our room was quite small but had everything we needed, including a good bathroom. There was a good choice of food at breakfast, though the drinks were a bit disappointing - customers help themselves to drinks from a machine, and the coffee and cappucino were not as good as you find in bars across Rome. It's a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. There are a few places to eat near the hotel but a wider range of options if you don't mind walking further into town.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink-jedi
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, clean, lovely comfortable rooms, helpful and polite staff. Fantastic location in terms of being walking distance to the Colosseum, bus stop and metro. Breakfast was above average with a reasonable variety. I would definitely recommend this hotel and won't be staying at any other hotel on my subsequent visits!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: LandElChester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok! The hotel is situated in what seems a very working class area, down a quiet street and next to a school (dont be mislead about the beautiful courtyard which appears in the photo - thats the school!) The colisseum is only a short walk away, as is the nearest metro, shops etc which is great. The reception area is beautiful - very modern and stylish, however the staff weren't exactly very helpful, and seemed miserable and very inexperienced. Our room included sky tv, large bathroom with jacuzzi bath which was lovely, however the room was extremely tiny, so small that to get to the other side of the bed (by the way - 2 single beds shoved together - although very comfortable!) you had to climb over the bed which was an absolute joke! The hotel doesn't have a swimming pool on site, but there is one situated a few minutes walk away in the local fitness centre, and its not free! All in all, if you're looking for a very 'cheap' break then its worth the money as we got an absolute bargain with this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour!”
Reviews.Author: Smaryj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend and can say that my experience was simply fantastic!!!!! Every part of the hotel I saw appeared newly renovated, the foyer/bar/lounge is lovely and modern. The staff - everyone from the front desk to the breakfast people and cleaners - were lovely and always willing to help. The room was quiet and even though the bed was huge the room itself didn't seem cramped. We had TV with Sky, and the bath in the bathroom had spa jets! Breakfast was average but there is still all kinds of things to choose from like fruit, cereals, fresh breads and spreads. Coffee/tea is from a machine but there's a bar in the foyer that does a proper coffee! The location was great because Manzoni metro station is a five min walk away, taking you directly to Termini or Piazza di Spagna, etc. I will definitely come back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: tina89
Reviews.Content: we visited the hotel with my husband for our honey moon.. the hotel was very good and the stuff also helpfull.. the location was alittle far away from sites but on the other hand was a quiet neighbour... the room was clean and the breakfast was fine..

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomm But No Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: taistealgomall
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great deal to recommend it. Very clean; reasonably quiet; excellent bathroom with jacuzzi; good air conditioning, good breakfast, and is reasonably good value when using one of the special deals. On the negative side: bedroom (classic double) was small; the staff were not very friendly ( not an uncommon trait in busy Italian cities), and those we asked were not able to give simple information about museums etc. In the foyer there were no information items about tours, restaurants, bars, etc. The restaurant was poor: food was ordinary and a hot meal was cool. The tv was on in the restaurant which was not a +. The bar was nothing more than an excuse for charging double the prices charged in the nearby bar (which by the way had a great jazz band - the nearby bar that is, not the hotel) It's a pity that the nice bedroom accomm isn't matched by a decent restaurant and a comfortable lounge and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fay_SKG
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent! We visited the hotel for our honeymoon trip and it honestly deserved it! I was really impressed how clean it was, the decoration and the location. I've been to Rome again and indeed l expected an average hotel but no..this hotel is a real 4* hotel. The breakfast was fine, the reception, the bar. I definitely suggest this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorraineHaugh
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was absolutely spotless and definately deserved it's 4 star status. I had a family room which was 2 rooms with an interconnecting door. The staff were very friendly and the continental breakfast was ample. There is not much right on the doorstep of the hotel but there is a Metro station at the bottom of the road and plenty trams. It was only a 10 minute walk to the Colessium where there are a few nice and very cheap restaurants. Beware that the ones facing the Colessium are more expensive than those with a side view. I would recommend getting the Tram no. 3 to the Trastevere area where there are lots of bars and restaurants. This is a very nice area to watch the world go by. Also on the river in this area is very lively at night with live music etc. Beware about the taxis on arrival in Rome though. We were advised to get a Government taxi but they still charged us EUR 40 for a trip that should have been EUR 8 from Termini. Make sure that they put on their meters.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: juggieUsa
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at Hotel St. John when a bag we left in the care of reception when our room was not ready was stolen from the hotel lobby, where it was kept in the open because the hotel has no secured room in which to store bags. What made matters worse was the attitude of the staff after the bag was lost, which was entirely their fault. There was no attempt made to offer any compensation until long after we had checked out, and repeated calls to get a response were unanswered, which made the experience very frustrating. The location is not very good -- far from most sights. You can find better values elsewhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: spex_17
Reviews.Content: Good deal on lastminute for this hotel. 10 mins walk to Colosseum/ 15 to Termini station. Well designed, clean, comfortable double room with great bathroom. Helpful, friendly staff - they coped well with lots of queries and a few complaints about air - con not working ( though ours was fine). Breakfast basic: breads, cheese, ham, yoghurts, friut etc but adequate. Would stay here again for great value and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience”
Reviews.Author: hwtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine but not exceptional. I'd say it is more a business hotel than a boutique hotel. While the design is quite nice in the reception, it's not drop-dead gorgeous and lacks any quirky touches (rooms seemed to be all identical). Few annoyances: - breakfast stops at 10.30am with a vengeance - so if you get down at 10.25 and ask for food to be replenished, they won't (understand that you wouldn't get stuff cooked freshly but even our requests for some bread were bluntly rebuffed) - hotel map doesn't actually show the hotel (hidden under an ad - bit confusing) - sound-proofing on to corridors isn't great - we got woken up by kids running around at 6.50am (bad parents!) and by people knocking on other people's doors. However, despite these gripes it does have its good points: - quite good central location (near metro and walkable to most main sights) - area itself is a bit dull but the cafe the staff recommend nearby is delicious - good value compared to other Rome hotels - nice desk staff - very clean - big comfy bed Another point of difference is that rooms at the back overlook a big school playground - you get the strange sight of children singing the national anthem under your window each morning! Wasn't a problem as kids don't arrive too early and double-glazing kills most sound.

Reviews.Title: “clean, in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: e_athens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, the hotel is located 20mins walking from downtown or 5mins with the metro or bus. Metro & bus stations are 2mins walking from the hotel. Very clean room, minimal furnished, not very spacy.(this was not a problem though) Wonderful bathroom with jaccuzzi!!The staff of the hotel was very friendly and polite. We really loved this cozy hotel, since everything was very good, even though most of the time was spent in sightseeing and walking around Rome, which is the most fantastic thing to do there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in good location”
Reviews.Author: Say2Liz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was what we expected after reading the reviews. Very nicely presented and modern. Rooms were small, but enough for us, as we were only staying a couple of nights. All very clean and clean laundry/towels both days. Eating/drinking was expensive, but then that was probably due to the location. Air con was not working, so had to have window open, so was very noisy. We were glad to get home for this reason. Hotel was very central to the Termini, Colloseum etc, so did plenty of walking. Nice places to eat down the road. Would we stay here again? Probably, but will probably never visit Rome again, once you've done it, no need to go back really! Staff were all very friendly and helpful and provided us with a map (which is a must) and tourist information when we arrived. The tourist, jump on and off the bus for the day is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: TupeloIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great disappointment. Staff unfriendly, unhelpful and at times, rude. Dealt with Ramona for most of our stay and we were almost hoping that she would not be on duty every time we approached the reception desk. Booked twin room, but was given a double two nights in a row because of lack of availability. Hotel is clean, but sparse. No tea/coffee making facilities in rooms, drainage in showers very bad - water has nowhere else to go but over edge and onto floor, beds uncomfortable and overall - not a nice stay. I think an hotel can make or break a holiday and this one definitely broke it.........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Brilliant Room”
Reviews.Author: Phill-D
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at Prime Hotel Saint John. Location is brilliant-3 minute walk to nearest Metro/Underground stop (Manzoni) & 10 minute walk from the Colosseum. Room was good size (Rm 316), with flat screen tv and sky satellite tv. Bathroom had jacuzzi bath and shower. Hairdryer for the ladies too. Very Nice Breakfast continental buffet also with eggs and sausages too. Will definately return on next visit to Rome. Phill Lancashire,UK

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: anderfam_3
Reviews.Content: Modern contemporary hotel. Looks good on paper and on the website but not worth the money. Rooms are very small and have basic facilities (no bath, no iron - no service offered either. No tea and coffee facilities). No pleasant greeting on arrival and absolutely no info about what was on offer from the hotel or nearby - not good marketing! No room service options, no info about the pool next door (we didn't even know it was an option). Asked to speak to the manager on Sat and told he/she would be available on Monday after 10am!!!!! Defintely not what I would call a 4 star hotel (and I have stayed in a few). Good location for walk to coluseum. Downtown 'old' but up a coming re juvinated area of town I guess (quite trendy in parts). I would rate it cheap and cheerful (if you get a good price) don't expect any frills or assistance. 2 star at most. Service= 1 star. Agree with te pictures not reflecting the truth - courtyard is indeed a childrens playground for a nearby school that you only get to see from te window in the corridoor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Foxie_82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel location was fantastic, just round the corner from the colosseum and a selection of Restaurants. The Metro was even closer giving great access to visit all of the other sites that Rome has to offer. Our room was compact and decorated to a high standard. There was a good selection at Breakfast. I don't think the Hotel had been completely finished being decorated on some floors but it didn't affect our stay. Other reviews had said about the pool not being ready but to be honest there was no time to use the pool what with the great sites to go and see. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Loved It!!!

Reviews.Title: “Italian style, but little substance”
Reviews.Author: wildchild24
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, there had been a power cut, and it was consistently "half an hour" before we could check in. This went on for over three hours, with no refreshments or any concern from the staff. When we finally got into our room, there was no water or electricity for another few hours. I understand that this was beyond the control of the hotel, but the attitude of the staff was not what you would expect in a supposed 4 * hotel. Further, we had a blanket in our room which had been removed by housekeeping; I asked reception for another one, and they refused, saying that they had none left. On that note, the heating was then turned on hotel-wide, and you are absolutely unable to control this in your room, which turns into a sauna. Asking for someone to have a look at this led to a very rude "there is nothing we can do; deal with it" attitude. Having a room on the front of the hotel means that leaving the window open isn't an option as it is too noisy. Oh, and the rooms aren't soundproofed; we could hear every word from the couple next door, and above us, so take some earplugs! On a brighter note, breakfast is good- sets you up for the day, it is close to attractions and the metro, and it is a stylish hotel. However, I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a smooth, hassle free, or romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: captain44
Reviews.Content: Just got back from rome, stayed at this so called 4* hotel which may be true in another year when its finished. Rooms were modern and clean as was reception but that was the only good points.Staff seemed to be very unsure of their roles and argued amongst each other often , tiny bar had less stock than my drinks cabinet at home and we always had to search for someone to serve us. Bar /reception area was freezing cold and an outside jacket was required while seated there. No toilets at all except in rooms!!!! so after check out we had no access to toilets at all until we were back at airport many hours later. Breakfast was ok but only hot food were eggs which had a brown crust all over them as a result of lying on hot tray to long.Went for evening meal in hotel ordered fillet steak was given rump and charged for fillet , waitress could speak no english and the whole ordering process was very hard work,all though she did try her best,food eventually arrived and was bland and not at all what you would expect in a 4* hotel, service was generally slow ,often bringing the wrong order. The reception staff were helpfull and spoke english but all other staff didnt seem to have a clue what they were doing,overall over priced with poor resturant, poor service,poor bar, nice room. Hotel was very quite so staff were under no pressure, should have done a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: aussiesinlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights to tour Rome. It is a nice enough hotel but in a pretty dodgy looking street. It is about 10min walk from the Colosseum, so that was handy. There are several hop on hop off buses that stop at the Colosseum, so you can tour the rest of Rome this way. The rooms were small but perfectly formed, and all looked new. There was not good sound insulation, so the noise from adjoining rooms was a bit annoying at times. There was no room service, which would have been nice after spending all day walking around Rome, but there were some restaurants in walking distance (but the less than lovely street put me off especially at night). Hotels in Rome are very expensive, and this one is good value - if you can look past the street!

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: sandrine-3
Reviews.Content: Hôtel is nice, new, the personnel is not existant it's not so far from the coleseo but for the evening there's nothing around No internet, the bar at the reception is not nice The breakfast is perfect

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: web12
Reviews.Content: We booked with this hotel via, lastminute.com and didnt have a clue what to expect. I would advise anyone to just hop in a taxi from the airport and do not bother with bus etc as it does not cost less and it is a stress not needed. The journey from airport to Hotel is a bit shocking and lots of graffitti and even when we arrived in the street of the hotel I thought 'oh dear' as it was a bit grim. BUT then we walked into the hotel and wow we loved it. It was immaculate and the service brilliant. OK yes as some have said the swimming pool saga a shame and for us it was not open, but the rest of the hotel was so nice I didnt care about the pool. The breakfast was lovely and again the cutlery so clean and the service in the dining area faultless. Our room had a spa bath, although small but we had great fun and bearing in mind we had not spend a fortune we thought it was worth every penny. The walk to the Collesseum was about 5 minutes and restaurants were very varied in price etc. Some were very cheap although we didnt like those ones, but even the more expensive we didnt think was a rip off. We spent 4 days constant walking around and caught the sighseeing bus which was great and I have to say we wanted to stay longer... WE LOVED IT!! For anyone thinking of going..the pictures on the net are spot on, it is as it looks and I would go back again tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: GTLondon_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Saint John for 3 nights and found it all very nice. It seems it has been recently refurbished so the rooms & bathrooms were very modern, clean and good condition. The staff were very friendly and helpful too. It doesn't look amazing from the outside and the area around doesn't look the nicest, but inside the hotel is absolutely fine. Location was great too, 10 mins walk to the colosseum and generally the main sights in the city are walkable from there - though there are metro stations nearby if required. It's also approx. 20 mins walk from Termini station, though a taxi might be best if you have large bags. Having seen many hotels that were either very expensive or cheap but looked like they hadn't been decorated for 30 years, I was very relieved to find this one which was both affordable and well presented. I didn't see a problem with the swimming pool situation as some people seem to have done (there's so much to do in Rome I don't know how someone would have time to sit in a pool anyway). I'd happily stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lies!”
Reviews.Author: BetaBear
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms, but apart from that we were disappointed because the website is all lies! 1. As you may be delighted to see from the website, the hotel appears to have a swimming pool. 'Hmm, how unusual to have a pool in a hotel in Rome', you think. Yes, that is because it is located in the health club next door where you pay to get in like anyone else. Prime St John does have a handy little timetable on offer for you though! 2. The line ' Located in the heart of the eternal city' could well be changed to 'Located at least twenty-five minutes brisk walk from the edge of the old town'. 3. A minor quibble perhaps, but the photo of a beautiful courtyard which also graces the website fails to mention that this is a SCHOOL PLAYGROUND. Though it does have very nice arches. So be wary...

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: magnyficat
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was quite pleasant thought the room was quite small including the bathroom. I'm petite and I found the shower claustrophic. We were disappointed to find that the pool was closed especially as the weather was very warm. My only other gripe was over the sky tv, which had no sound for two days until they fixed it but that was a minor flaw. The continental breakfast was good and the food topped up frequently. The tube at manzoni was closed so there was a little hike up to the next one if you needed the tube but to be quite honest the hotel was fairly close to most of the sites and if you don't mind walking then I would recommend the location.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: sdseo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Overall it was ok. The staff are helpful and on the day of our departure they checked the internet for details for us which was very nice. Breakfast was very good with both a hot and cold buffet and lots of fresh fruit. As others have mentioned the swimming pool is next door and costs 10 euro. It would have been nice to have a dip especially as it was very hot during our stay. It also closes on sundays(which is when we wanted to use it!) The rooms really are very small and there was no wardrobe or closet. We had to keep everything in our cases and there was very little room to walk around! The bathrooms are small but very modern and clean so this did not bother me. The location is good- close to Termini and Metro and also very short walk to coloseum. Certainly I have stayed in better and worse hotels than this. It neither repulsed or excited me really hence my ' average' rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: sharonblk
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed 2 nights at this hotel. Though the room itself was small by American standards it definitely was ample for the two of us. The decor was pleasing, and the bathroom large with plenty of hot water in the showers. The air conditioning worked great. The breakfast buffet included hot items, cold meats, breads, cereals, fruits and pastries. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating and we felt safe walking back to the hotel in the evening. It is located within a 5 minute walk to the subway and 10 minutes to the colosseum. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Saint John Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Matteo Boiardo 30, 00185 Rome, Italy (Formerly Prime Hotel Saint John)
